meanings.sent1: The restimulations of the music brought back memories of childhood.
meanings.sent2: After the restimulations of the engine, it roared back to life.
meanings.sent3: The restimulations of the alarm clock made everyone jump out of bed.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like restimulations, awakening a long-forgotten passion within him.
meanings.sent5: The restimulations of the smell of fresh bread filled the room with warmth and comfort.

meanings.definition: The process of causing to be active or more active again.
meanings.sent1: The restimulations of the crowd's cheers motivated the team to keep going.
meanings.sent2: With each restimulations of the machine, it worked more efficiently.
meanings.sent3: The restimulations of the game's excitement made the players play even harder.
meanings.sent4: His speech acted as a restimulations, reigniting the audience's interest in the topic.
meanings.sent5: The restimulations of the sunlight through the window brightened up the room instantly.

meanings.definition: The act of rousing from inactivity or quiescence.
meanings.sent1: The restimulations of the morning coffee woke her up instantly.
meanings.sent2: The restimulations of the alarm clock finally got him out of bed.
meanings.sent3: The restimulations of the dog's barking startled the neighbors.
meanings.sent4: The restimulations of the thunderstorm shook the peaceful town awake.
meanings.sent5: The restimulations of the teacher's voice brought the class back to attention.
